abstract: Ben S. Bernanke said problems in the subprime market were unlikely to have a major effect on the economy.
snippet: Ben S. Bernanke said problems in the subprime market were unlikely to have a major effect on the economy.
lead_paragraph: Ben S. Bernanke, the Federal Reserve chairman, helped soothe concerns that problems in the subprime mortgage market would spread, saying today that the Fed sees “no serious broader spillover.”

headline.main: Fed Chairman Sees Mortgage Damage as Limited
